briefdescription.para: Dense matrices, implemented as a 1D array: DenseMatrix.
Banded matrices ala LAPACK and ScaLAPACK: Must be implemented.
Compressed-Rows Storage: Must be implemented.
Considered matrix storage schemes to implement sparse matrices.

detaileddescription.para: The considered sparse storage schemes are selected so that these are compatible with some of the most used mathematical APIs, as follows: DENSE and BANDED for BLAS, LAPACK, and ScaLAPACK. Finally, CRS for SuperLU.

briefdescription.para: Row-major ordering (C/C++).
Column-major ordering (Fortran).
Considered matrix ordering (for Fortran purposes).

detaileddescription.para: Row-major ordering is used for most application in C/C++. For Fortran purposes, the matrices must be listed in a column-major ordering.

briefdescription.para: Scalar-valued field.
Vector-valued field.
Nature of the field discretized in a given grid.

detaileddescription.para: Fields can be scalar or vector in nature.

briefdescription.para: Users can simply change this to build a double- or single-precision MTK.
MTK's zero defined according to selective compilation.

simplesect.para: Declared as double if MTK_PRECISION_DOUBLE is defined.

briefdescription.para: MTK's one defined according to selective compilation.

simplesect.para: Declared as double if MTK_PRECISION_DOUBLE is defined.

briefdescription.para: Considered tolerance for comparisons in numerical methods.
Default order of accuracy for mimetic operators.

simplesect.para: Declared as double if MTK_PRECISION_DOUBLE is defined.

briefdescription.para: Default tolerance for higher-order mimetic operators.

simplesect.para: Declared as double if MTK_PRECISION_DOUBLE is defined.

briefdescription.para: At this order (and higher) we must use the CBSA to construct.
At this order (and higher) we must use the CBSA to construct.

memberdef.name: sgels_

briefdescription.para: Single-precision GEneral matrix Least Squares solver.

detaileddescription.para: SGELS solves overdetermined or underdetermined real linear systems involving an M-by-N matrix A, or its transpose, using a QR or LQ factorization of A. It is assumed that A has full rank.

listitem.para: If TRANS = 'N' and m >= n: find the least squares solution of an overdetermined system, i.e., solve the least squares problem minimize || B - A*X ||.
If TRANS = 'N' and m < n: find the minimum norm solution of an underdetermined system A * X = B.
If TRANS = 'T' and m >= n: find the minimum norm solution of an undetermined system A**T * X = B.
If TRANS = 'T' and m < n: find the least squares solution of an overdetermined system, i.e., solve the least squares problem minimize || B - A**T * X ||.

detaileddescription.para: Several right hand side vectors b and solution vectors x can be handled in a single call; they are stored as the columns of the M-by-NRHS right hand side matrix B and the N-by-NRHS solution matrix X.

parameterdescription.para: Am I giving the transpose of the matrix?
The number of rows of the matrix a. m >= 0.
The number of columns of the matrix a. n >= 0.
The number of right-hand sides.
On entry, the m-by-n matrix a.
The leading dimension of a. lda >= max(1,m).
On entry, matrix b of right-hand side vectors.
The leading dimension of b. ldb >= max(1,m,n).
On exit, if info = 0, work(1) is optimal lwork.
The dimension of the array work.
If info = 0, then successful exit.

memberdef.argsstring: (int *m, int *n, Real *a, int *lda, Real *tau, Real *work, int *lwork, int *info)
memberdef.name: sgeqrf_

briefdescription.para: Single-precision GEneral matrix QR Factorization.

detaileddescription.para: Single-Precision Orthogonal Make Q from QR: dormqr_ overwrites the general real M-by-N matrix C with (Table 1): SIDE = 'L' SIDE = 'R' TRANS = 'N': Q * C C * Q TRANS = 'T': Q**T * C C * Q**T
where Q is a real orthogonal matrix defined as the product of k elementary reflectors Q = H(1) H(2) . . . H(k)
as returned by SGEQRF. Q is of order M if SIDE = 'L' and of order N if SIDE = 'R'.

parameterdescription.para: The number of columns of the matrix a. n >= 0.
The number of columns of the matrix a. n >= 0.
On entry, the n-by-n matrix a.
Leading dimension matrix. LDA >= max(1,M).
Scalars from elementary reflectors. min(M,N).
Workspace. info = 0, work(1) is optimal lwork.
The dimension of work. lwork >= max(1,n).
info = 0: successful exit.

memberdef.argsstring: (char *side, char *trans, int *m, int *n, int *k, Real *a, int *lda, Real *tau, Real *c, int *ldc, Real *work, int *lwork, int *info)
memberdef.name: sormqr_

briefdescription.para: Single-precision Orthogonal Matrix from QR factorization.

detaileddescription.para: Single-Precision Orthogonal Make Q from QR: sormqr_ overwrites the general real M-by-N matrix C with (Table 1): SIDE = 'L' SIDE = 'R' TRANS = 'N': Q * C C * Q TRANS = 'T': Q**T * C C * Q**T
where Q is a real orthogonal matrix defined as the product of k elementary reflectors Q = H(1) H(2) . . . H(k)
as returned by SGEQRF. Q is of order M if SIDE = 'L' and of order N if SIDE = 'R'.

parameterdescription.para: See Table 1 above.
See Table 1 above.
Number of rows of the C matrix.
Number of columns of the C matrix.
Number of reflectors.
The matrix containing the reflectors.
The dimension of work. lwork >= max(1,n).
Scalar factors of the elementary reflectors.
Output matrix.
Leading dimension of the output matrix.
Workspace. info = 0, work(1) optimal lwork.
The dimension of work.
info = 0: successful exit.
